bow: ok ladies any experience with mirena iud the message boards are flooded with negative comments and wonder if that is because people with positive experiences do rant weeks pp got mine inserted am hoping we made the right decision my doctor told me there would be minimal side effects because the device sends hormones only locally keep wondering if she is full of shit the more read online not my experience but my friends she got one and started having trouble with it from the start it was painful gave her cysts and ended up failing out the day she was going back to the doctors to have them check it she has had it in almost years and still gets cysts although she has had one in few months my other friend got one and it ended up shifting and she got small cyst as well my doctor asked if wanted one and said no thanks ll stick to the pill interesting because it claims to prevent cysts we have commercials here from law firms about class action suits against mirena because it causes cysts even looked it up online for the side effects and it also says it can cause cysts the told my friend to take birth control pills without taking the sugar pills so she does get her period to prevent the cysts it also supposed to stop your period but my one friend was bleeding constantly have one and have literally nothing bad to say about it see lot of anecdotal stories from people about their friends or family members issues with them but ve never really hear anybody say anything negative for themselves had one inserted at weeks post baby and it been about and half months with zero issues my periods are now basically day or two of spotting now and it ended up being much more affordable than paying for monthly prescription love mine or should say loved had one for years and recently had it removed was supposed to get new one the exact same visit but there was complication not the fault of the device so had to put it off as soon as can get an appointment to get new one am ripping off my clothes and hopping into the stirrups before they get the door closed am not dismissing the negative experiences that some have had but think it like you say if you re happy with it you forget about it and you re not seeking out websites to share your story so online info is skewed towards users who have had problems it may not be for everyone but it works just fine for some people and hope you are one of them would say had little discomfort the first month it was like weird awareness of it at times like was being poked or made crampy but once that subsided was super happy with the thing no periods for five years sign me up thanks for your reply woohoo knew there had be good stories out there had one for about three years no problems at all until it somehow moved think during sexy times then it hurt but not due to anything really other than user faults guess never got new one though all and all was pretty good got one in december and so far it great my one complaint is that it has made my periods longer instead of shorter but it can take some time to reduce them and they are finally starting to get lighter at this point mine is due to be removed this oct which means ve had it for almost years and have had cysts almost the entire time edit accidentally hit submit will elaborate so have tried the pill nuva ring patch over the years and fairly happy with the mirena do have to think about it plan for it mess with it etc which is why even though suffer through burst cyst once month have had it prematurely removed come october though not sure if will have another one put in got one at weeks pp as well and love it still nursing so between that and the mirena have had period since july 2012 no complaints here just curious if you looked into paraguard at the time you were researching mirena same thing except it lasts twice as long and is hormonal which is why chose it have the mirena and like it but there are some inconvenient side effects love that my periods are less severe heavy but have more discharge than did prior to getting it and it pretty much constant have to wear panty liner everyday doctor said it was normal just was expecting it she also said it should subside as time goes on but it has not my son will be this month and think got the mirena about 10 weeks pp other than that it is great love not having to worry about taking pill everyday have you gained weight have any issues losin baby weight that is scary was it some really good sex never had problem with mine at all had it in for 2yrs definitely worth it would do it again haha actually was with my now husband he freaked out and was like there something wrong with your lady bits it poking me it funny now but then it was it was more uncomfortable than hurt guess because then could feel it no damage or anything so no worries it just moved doctor said it was pretty rare for that to happen though got cysts too can you explain paraguard and do you like if it available in canada it is available in canada it the copper version and much less expensive was given an info sheet on it from women hospital bc one of the side effects was heavier period though two years and mostly happy the only reason do say totally is because havesecond tthoughts about hormonal birth control and its effect on me but its debatable and may or may not be related to mirena have paraguard love it have noticed that my cramps are bit more focused than they used to be like it used to be general cramps now its like one knot of cramps but seriously loving not being on hormones paraguard is based more on the copper method rather than the hormonal thing it just kills them sperms but they are basically the same shape and size implanted in the same method paraguard lasts twice as long because its not based on hormones chose it because at the time was suffering from ppd and did want to throw more hormones on that fire no regrets absolutely looked at this one too however read horrifying reviews and my doctor told me she does recommend it for anyone because of the adverse side effects what about weight gain no that has not been an issue thankfully debatable weigh about the same as did pretty pregnancy but ve been trying to lose this may have lot more to do with me than my birth control if wanted to could say the birth control makes me fat and use it like crutch but if being truly honest with myself feel my weight has more to do with my lack of will power and personal failures rather than the iud its my personal belief that lot of people not all of them of course will blame something particularly birth control for weight gain if they can so they dont have to blame themselves we ve all heard it its my genetics its my birth control too busy to eat better or exercise but ve seen plenty of women whose lives changed lot when they became sahms and they gained weight sitting at home with the baby which is when most people get an iud it has less to do with bc and more to do with diet and exercise hormones make me bleed like for mouths on end so it copper iud then as long as that period does last month on end then good hormones make me bleed doctor could never figure out why ve had mine for about months and love it one of the lucky gals who do get period anymore and ve lost almost 90 lbs while ve had it got pretty big with the baby if your partner can feel it it is either new and the strings have softened or they are two long and need to be trimmed have mirena got it weeks pp my little one is now little over years old have loved it and would definitely recommend it yes have gained weight but believe that more due to me going to school and working and not making time for eating right and exercising the only complaint was that the first couple months my husband would complain that the strings were rather sharp and would hurt him during intercourse but after few months they softened up we learned which positions worked in the meantime the string softens over time well then it sounds like good option for you always happy to provide the bright side an unexpected upside having *really* nasty case of baby fever and having birth control method that ca be spontaneous with is forcing my husband and to keep the timeline we planned before my son was born because deep down know need to finish up my degree before we have another but damn cramping had never previously been period cramper but after the adjustment they went away again and my period was actually slightly lighter than it was before the paragard a+++ will put into my uterus again had one between baby and for about years removed it to have no issues whatsoever on that front and ve had one since as well for years now love the mirena really really really love it am not are so light it almost laughable mean one panty liner period and they are not usually month apart more like months apart would definitely recommend it it the best form of birth control ve ever used there is nothing do like about it completely anecdotal but had super heavy and long lasting periods before getting the paragard so was too concerned about getting heavier periods because they honestly probably be unnoticeably longer after the acclimation to the paragard cycles my periods were actually bit more normal it was awesome highly recommend the paragard if hormones ~~are~~aren t** right for constant annoyance since then ve had days of spotting per month nothing that you could call typical period for sure had horrific cysts before had baby and would regularly have to be off work when had my period as the pain was so intense was hospitalized several time with no solution do know if it was the pregnancy or the mirena but so far have had repeat of that since before got pregnant am very hormone sensitive and had really hard time being on the pill the locally distributed hormones did bother me especially certainly noticed that feeling of instability in the beginning but nothing major and it did last long have heard that the issues that can come along with it are often due to improper insertion it has to be in the right spot to be most comfortable and effective so make sure you are going to an ob gyn that has done it before and knows more than just the basics my only negative is that my husband reports he can sometimes feel the strings but even that is pretty minor does seem to bother him too much really yeah my doctor said the opposite too ve had it for like six months and aside from having heavy periods love it they may be heavy but they do last as long and only got cramping the first month really did also have other factors that think influenced their suggestion of that to me though was just curious because it seems like all the bad press about mirena is due to the hormones anyway you go about it though iuds are the bomb another good story for your collection on my second one had the first put in after my first baby and it was wonderful removed it when we wanted to try again got pregnant right away and had another one placed weeks postpartum no periods no pregnancies no side effects well maybe clearer skin and love it was concerned with negative rants read online but my doctor said huge majority of her patients with iuds have no problems whatsoever and they re so easy to remove if you are in the minority am on my 4th one had one put in after my first daughter was born and loved it the hormones wore off sooner than years for me so got new one every years had it taken out when my husband and were ready to have our baby 10 years after the first had baby had my current one put in love love love it will say that it takes while for the cramping to go away but after that had lighter periods than ever no more mood swings or weird weight fluctuations did try the paraguard before did the mirena after my first never again heavy heavy bleeding like through tampon pad my undies and my jeans within two hours so that one is not for me ve had two got one before my first child and had new one inserted after her birth the second was removed when we decided to try for another kid think it highly effective and did seem to impact my fertility there can be transition and heavier periods at first but found that went away quickly since my insurance covered it the potential was for years of contraception for co pay of 30 if it affordable say try it if you do like it you can remove it oh and the installation hurt still worth it imho my midwife considers the copper one an abortifacient although do know why she will do the mirena which she considers birth control and has another practitioner do the paraguard deleted have the mirena got mine at weeks pp as well most of the time it not problem but other times it an annoyance now that my 2nd is over year getting the essure done later this month the annoying parts are these sometimes it stabs my husband during sex and after sex spot for the next day really light but still stains the underoos actually after exercising or running will spot some too and now some positions are uncomfortable for me during sex finally my periods are now 10 days of spotting plus all the extra spotting if ve been randy however have not gained weight with it ve actually lost about 25lbs with diet and exercise however short and have curve in my spine so there may be pressure on my uterus that others do have ve had one since december all is well had read someone else on reddit say that months ago when was considering if wanted mirena or paraguard and asked my midwife about it because while totally pro choice could bare the thought of doing any potential kids harm as silly as that sounds to read she assured me that they both work the same was hoping she give me some insight as to why people say that if they re both the same but she did really explain am still pretty curious on it yup old tricks are sometimes just as good how did you know the hormones wore off earlier than the five years on year and do want any surprises love mine wish gotten one sooner although the thing your doctor said is not true in order to suppress ovulation which happens to most mirena users the hormones need to reach the anterior pituitary gland and the hypothalamus which are not in your uterus which means they travel through your bloodstream to your brain mine was well it worked had it for about years we expected to have to wait longer before having our second pros basically no side effects do have to think about it or do anything though you should check the strings periodically no spotty and older blood basically it seemed that the iud was blocking the blood they said there are no negative effects of this it was just kind of annoying have had one for almost year and both me and
